subject: Economics
title: Intellectual Property: Ideas as Property
description: A 60-second lesson on Intellectual Property: Ideas as Property.

hook.text: A pill costs $0.10 to manufacture and $2 billion to develop. Without patents, the copycat sells it for $0.

buildup.text: Patents grant a temporary monopoly: 20 years to be the sole seller.

discovery.text: The patent system worked well for physical inventions.

twist.text: Patent trolls ‚Äî companies that own patents but make nothing ‚Äî sue real innovators.

climax.text: IP protection is a balancing act: too little and nobody invests; too much and nobody can build.

punchline.text: Intellectual property is meant to reward creators.

quiz.question: What is the economic tradeoff of patent protection?
options: Higher prices today (monopoly period) fund the research that creates innovations everyone eventually benefits from
